question:
Given the (i) ________ of the book, the critical reception was surprisingly (ii) ________; reviewers who usually pounce on the slightest orthodoxy met the text with unabashed approbation.
Blank (i)
Blank (ii)
A. ingenuity
D. tepid
B. tortuousness
E. laudatory
C. conventionality
F. deprecating
